Submodules¶

torchnlp.metrics.accuracy module¶

torchnlp.metrics.accuracy.get_accuracy(targets, outputs, k=1, ignore_index=None)[source]¶

Compute the accuracy of o == t {o in outputs and t in targets.

Parameters:
  • targets (list of tensors) –
  • outputs (list of tensors) –
  • ignore_index (optional, int) – Specifies a target value that is ignored computing equality
Returns:

accuracy (float) number correct (int) total (int)

torchnlp.metrics.bleu module¶

torchnlp.metrics.bleu.get_moses_multi_bleu(hypotheses, references, lowercase=False)[source]¶

Calculate the bleu score for hypotheses and references using the MOSES multi-bleu.perl script.

Parameters:
  • hypotheses – List of strings where each string is a single example.
  • references – List of strings where each string is a single example.
  • lowercase – If true, pass the “-lc” flag to the multi-bleu script
Returns:

The BLEU score as a float32 value.

torchnlp.metrics.get_moses_multi_bleu(hypotheses, references, lowercase=False)[source]¶

Calculate the bleu score for hypotheses and references using the MOSES multi-bleu.perl script.

Parameters:
  • hypotheses – List of strings where each string is a single example.
  • references – List of strings where each string is a single example.
  • lowercase – If true, pass the “-lc” flag to the multi-bleu script
Returns:

The BLEU score as a float32 value.
